meanings.definition: To make Western in character, customs, or ideas.
meanings.sent1: The school decided to westernize its curriculum by adding more courses on Western history and literature.
meanings.sent2: Many countries around the world have chosen to westernize their legal systems to align with international standards.
meanings.sent3: When the alien tried to westernize their spaceship, it ended up looking like a Wild West saloon in space.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion sense was so unique that she managed to westernize even the most traditional outfits.
meanings.sent5: The artist's goal was to westernize the ancient art form by incorporating modern techniques and themes.

meanings.definition: To bring under Western influence or control.
meanings.sent1: The explorer sought to westernize the remote tribe by introducing them to Western technology and practices.
meanings.sent2: During the colonial era, many regions were westernized through the imposition of Western laws and governance.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to westernize the backyard by claiming it as its territory and enforcing strict rules on the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The company's aggressive marketing campaign aimed to westernize the local market and establish dominance over competitors.
meanings.sent5: The powerful empire sought to westernize neighboring kingdoms through trade agreements and cultural exchanges.
